administrative appeals tribunal act 1975 (cth.), ss. 3(3) , 25 (1)(a).  statutes
interpretation
"made in the exercise of powers conferred by that enactment"
meaning of

administrative appeals tribunal act 1975 (cth.), ss. 3(3) , 25 (1)(a). this was an appeal from a decision of the administrative appeals tribunal ("the tribunal") setting aside a decision of the collector of customs, new south wales, to revoke a private warehouse licence issued to the respondent subject to the provisions of the customs act 1901 (cth.), the regulations made thereunder and subject to conditions specified on the back of the written licence. the tribunal held that it possessed jurisdiction and made an order setting aside the purported revocation on the ground that the power of revocation which the collector purported to exercise did not exist.  held: per bowen c.j. and smithers j., deane j. dissenting

the appeal should be dismissed because: (1) the phrase "made in the exercise of powers conferred by that enactment" in s. 25(1)(a) of the administrative appeals tribunal act 1975 (cth.) properly construed means in purported exercise of powers conferred by the enactment.
